intro: Homocnemia meyeriana, commonly known as the Meyer's homocnemia, is a rare species of liverwort found in specific moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Porellaceae and is characterized by its delicate, thalloid structure. The plant exhibits a complex arrangement of lobes and is typically found on rocky substrates in tropical and subtropical regions. Its reproductive structures, known as gametophores, are specialized for spore production. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
